item.title: Your App Shouldn't Have a Happy Path
item.description: What if instead of deciding what your app should do, you let it figure that out for each user? There’s something happening with coding agents right now that makes this possible. I’m not talking about ChatGPT or Claude apps you use every day. I’m talking about agents that have access to tools - they can browse your files, query databases, read documentation, hit APIs. They have all the context they need.

item.title: Sharing knowledge in a remote team, across timezones
item.description: “True innovation comes an intersection of a cross-pollination of roles and ideas” - Sunil, former-CTO@Buffer I’ve been working remotely at Buffer for 6 years now. As a software engineer, one of the critical skill I believe we should must have is being able to learn continuously. However, working in a fully distributed team, split accross 10+ timezones. I live in Asia (UTC +8) while most of my teammates live in the US or Europe.
